intro: Pentapanax mexicanus, commonly known as Mexican five-leaf, is a climbing shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves that typically consist of five leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
